alert.note: Alert for Clay; Leslie (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 3:22AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Leslie and central Clay Counties through 345 AM EDT... At 322 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Goose Rock, or near Manchester, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Botto, Plank and Lipps around 325 AM EDT. Hector around 330 AM EDT. Peabody, Marcum, Enline, Creekville, Spring Creek, Spurlock and Barcreek around 335 AM EDT. Bear Branch, Bobs Fork, Big Creek, Jacks Creek and Brutus around 340 AM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
